review: The employees are very nice but service here is terrible. It took them an hour to get my appetizer. I finally just asked for it to go and had to stand by the kitchen to get it. The food here is average . I come here because it's down the street and easy, but it's just not worth it anymore. Second time this location  has ruined my evening.
Ordered Take Out - Wild Mushroom Pasta ) - $16.50 for a small portion  - No bread, No cheese...    Oh - it came with cutlery, napkin and a paper bag - Woohooo! Wont be back

I hadn't been to a California Pizza Kitchen in a good while, but I am pregnant and craving a Tostada pizza so my grandmother joined me for dinner. We were able to get seated right away and asked by the hostess if we've visited their restaurant lately- which we hadn't. After ordering drinks, we were greeted by the manager with a delicious complimentary flatbread. Great service.

Mission Viejo CPK is a favorite of mine, but they discontinued my favorite salad - the Chinese Chicken salad. The potato soup was an adequate substitute, but I was ready for my favorite. By the way, the manager, Trisha, was great and our waiter Chris was efficient, fun and personable. I'll definitely go back, but I they bring back my favorite salad.

This location has a very rude girl working ,her name is Claudia. Very rude and unprofessional. The management here is not good at all. Food you order is not always correct and service is bad. I love every other orange count CPK locations. My friends and I have had very bad experience at this one. If craving CPK stay away from this one!

They have a lot of new items on their menu,  the Brussel bacon Flatbread is really good... If you do get dessert you have to get the butter cake!! Omg! The cake is hot and the ice cream on top is so delicious!

I do think CPK has stepped up their game a bit. Plenty of menu options besides just pizza, healthy offerings as well. I enjoy their soups and salads and even the salmon here was pretty good. Service was fine, food came out quickly. Portions are descent, but it is a bit pricey for chain restaurant food. Clean restaurant with plenty of seating, descent food but not worth going out of my way to return.

The server Andrea gave horrible service. From the minute we sat down, she had attitude. Then the pastas my friend and I ordered weren't cooked all the way, so we had to basically flag her down so we could tell her. She just said ok and took our plates away. She never offered us bread either but brought her other tables bread... aren't they supposed to offer it to you? When she finally came back I told her I wanted to change my order, she gave me an annoyed look. When our pastas came out again, mine still wasn't fully cooked but I was starving so I wasn't going to send it back again. Andrea was just rude and short with our table the entire time

This is not the first time this happened. It's ridiculous.... why is it so hard to put fresh lettuce in a salad. I called them last month after this happened and after I found a dead fly in the lettuce too. They refunded my order. I can't keep calling over and over for this dead lettuce. Thus is my last time coming here for salad.  BTW this is the grilled veggie salad with chicken and it's $20 I get it at least 1-2 times a month.  Unbelievable

My husband and I went to CPK  because we have never been here before, we ordered a salad and spaghetti. They were very bland and not very good. As we finished the manager or owner not sure which (Elliot) came over and said how are was your food? Long story short he compt our food and gave us $30 gift card because he wanted us to come back and try it again,he also told us all of the amazing stuff to order next time we where very pleased that he took his time to explain the menu and  to make sure we where happy!

We started out a little put off. We had to wait to be seated and we waited nearly 10 minutes and we were seated directly in the sun! I was not happy with sitting in the direct sunlight.      The food was delicious but, you have to ask for the complimentary bread you get with your meal. The service was otherwise great. My Thai Chicken pizza was delicious! The butter cake was deliciously scrumptious but, it took a while bringing the cake out. It was worth the wait though.     We will be back but, will speak up next time about poor seating.
Great place to spend time with the family but most importantly great food! The pizza though is too much (price range) for the size it comes in but other than that the pastas are amazing.

Recently I've noticed the quality of food from cpk has really increased. Either they have better people cooking and preparing the food or higher quality food or a combination of both. Regardless, the food here is surprisingly good when compared to for example Cheesecake Factory. Very surprised. Hope they keep this up as I'd pick CPK over the other similar style restaurants 10/10 times

Modern looking decor and delish food.  Parking is open and curbside to go is a winner.   Hummus appetizer and avocado egg rolls are THE BUSINESS.   Their flat breads and pastas are winners, too.  I often opt for an entree salad with shrimp - a bit pricey but it keeps me full and feels light.   Server was incredible last time, wish I knew her name to give her a shout out/street cred.  Will just have to go back again and find her!
Thanks for the great service Kristina M.! I appreciate you getting us in and out so quickly!

This place... one word sums it up. Ridiculous!!! For starters it wasn't really that packed for a Friday night. The service by our server iman was slow, worse than slow for a half salad and mac & cheese. Took over 30 mins. Then I ordered a refill on a Coke and it got delivered to me over 10 minutes later by another server "female" then when we told her for a refill for an ice-tea she forgot and so we told our original server and that too took over 10 minutes. I have never seen so many employees all with a sense of no rush to work... I will never come back here and if you have any respect for your hard earned time off to relax and enjoy your weekend you too will never come here. Hope this review helps you to not waste your time...

Exceptional service was experienced here yesterday. The staff wanted to make us happy and felt good about serving us. We had a gift card that my parents-in-law had given us and were using it a second time. $50 goes a long way at a CPK. We placed our orders: 1) A carnitas pizza with habanero sauce on the side 2) A Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza. We opted for the traditional crust on both pizza, as neither of us has celiac disease. California Pizza Kitchen's menu had gluten-free options for their crusts for those who have celiac. We ordered these drinks: 1) Ginger Ale 2) Lemonade. The drinks were refilled for free, as per CPK's policy. I also asked for a glass of ice water, which was also refilled upon request. We enjoyed sharing our pizzas. The carnitas pizza is really good - they placed a lot of tender carnitas on the pizza. The habanero sauce went well with the pizza and really spiced it up and added flavor.  The Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza was similar to the regular BBQ Chicken Pizza. The only difference was that it included pineapple, which made for a sweeter, tangier taste. As usual, there were leftovers. A staff member boxed up our pizzas, which had instructions for re-heating printed out on the top of the box. The leftovers tasted great the next day. We were pleased with our visit and found it a great value.

Went here today with my family and was a horrible experience. I always see this place packed so I decided to try it out. Boy was I disappointed the food wasn't good at all it had no flavor. I could get better pizza at Selmas for the same price. I will not be back.

As a regular at CPK, this was a good experience. The restaurant was bright and welcoming with that casual CPK ambiance. Stopped by on a Tuesday afternoon with my girlfriend and we were seated within five minutes. Our waitress took our drink orders and returned soon to take our meal orders, as well as offering some bread.  CPK has never disappointed me with it's food and I was more than satisfied with my meal. We were checked on an appropriate amount and our waitress was overall very friendly! A great location that I would definitely come back to when in the area.

Unfortunately both the food selection and quality has gone way downhill at this location. Tonight we just had the worst foods we've ever had here. Salmon was a little bit off, and overcooked. Pizza, even, was super thin even though it wasn't thin crust and seemed to have barely any cheese on the slices. :( I have thirteen checkins here, and I think it will stay at that number for a long long time.

Not  a dog friendly place!  Most of the time, when I go to any restaurant with an outdoor patio, they allow you to bring in your dog from the side gate.  So disappointed the waitress told us only guide dog is allowed.  I really didn't see any sign saying no pets.  Further, I've been to CPK at Laguna Hills and they allow dog in the patio area.  I won't be going here until CPK change this policy.  Mission Viejo is a dog friendly town!

My wife and I stopped by California Pizza.  We rarely eat at California Pizza Kitchen as we have found many other better places.  On this evening we decided to give it another try.   The parking lot was full, as was the the restaurant.  We walked in and were immediately seated.  Lots of kids, lots of noise, screams shouts and general jubilation.   I ordered a pizza called the meat lovers, yes like pizza hut.  25 minutes later a mildly warm pizza was dropped off.  Because it was only warm, it reminded me of day old pizza from my bachelor days.  The quality was just north of sloppa johns.  Light stiff cheese, little meat, plenty of grease. We won't be back.

My wife and I go to CPK MV about once a month.  Sit at the bar.  Like to watch the food process and don't want to wait to be seated.  Sat down.  Counter was dirty from previous customer.  Male server said "be right with you"!  Normal female server must have been off?  15 minutes later, still waiting for (someone) to clean the counter and offer to serve us!   We left.

Very sweet and good looking host and server. I grew up with this cpk, and the reason I give 4 stars rather than 5 is because of the changes that they have made. It appears like you guys are downgrading. Bad call on the changes to the darker bread, staff wearing jeans, and chalked name tags. The old bread with cpk butter, real name tags with the location of where staff was from.. Way more pro. Great food and service tho.. Lose the jeans

Run of the mill food, nothing different from several other CPK locations. Some of the pizzas are good, I once decided on the salmon entree instead. This was clearly a mistake, the fish seemed flavourless, and I would be happy with the meal, only if there were no other choices around. However, that isn't the case, so this place features as the last resort in my category of 'open late', 'predictable food' and 'easy to get to'.

I called in, placed an order on Tuesday night. Asked for BBQ Chicken pizza, Focaccia Chicken Caesar sandwich (which they don't carry anymore, it is on ciabatta now apparently) and 2 side caesar salads. Came inside to pick up and waited behind another takeout customer for about 10-15 minutes even though it wasn't busy- the 3 people working the takeout station were laughing and talking to each other (there was a 2nd open register...), completely ignoring me. When I finally reached the desk, the girl (I don't remember her name, but she had braces) reviewed my order in which she said I ordered a side caesar and a side house salad with caesar. I told her I ordered TWO caesars and she tried to convince me that a house salad is "practically the same" as a caesar salad "except with carrots and stuff" - sorry, not in my opinion. I asked for TWO, not ONE. Took awhile for her to come back with the order - she placed the sandwich and salads in the bag; I asked for bread and butter AND a side of caesar dressing twice (once on the phone and in person). She pulled out the pizza from under her desk which was odd. Once I got home, the pizza looked OLD, it was cold and tasted like cardboard. BOTH salads were composed of a couple of pieces of lettuce (wilted) that barely covered the bottom of the container, no parmesan, and less than half of a container of dressing for each salads (not to mention, no extra side as I had asked). The ciabatta on the sandwich was broken and crushed, making the whole thing fall apart. Oh, and we only got bread, no butter (as I had asked for twice!) Overall, I feel like the past couple times I have come to CPK (either eating in or taking out), I am paying for a low quality, small portioned, skimped version of a meal for raised prices. I can't believe I paid nearly $40 for this!! And what is with the menu changes? They are worse, not better. Example: focaccia was great! Ciabatta is a poor trade. I definitely don't plan on returning to any of their restaurants which is a shame - my family and I had been coming here for years.

Ok.  Obivously CPK is corporate and over-rated, but it does have some 4 star food on the menu!   ***The 2 stars I am giving it is NOT because of the food or the service.  As mentioned earlier the food is 4 and the service is actually a 4-5*** So why the 2 starts?  Because when I dine in I expect the overall odor of a restaurant to be a the very least neutral and to max out at smelling the delight aromas of the exotic cuisines coming from the kitchen.  To be 100% honest: The place smells bad.  Like an interesting combination of butter, stale dorritos, and smelly feet.  --But all joking aside, it does smell pretty bad in the interior and I've eaten at that place now 2 times.   So you could imagine my amazement when I noticed that all of the people enjoyed the experience of eating in the restaurant!   However, this time grace seemed to give me more wisdom and the confidence to match, than my last experience there and so I  spoke up and requested a seat outside.  Out there I was able to enjoy the food and company I was with.  I'm a veggie fucaccia sandwich addict!  That's always been my favorite item on the menu! The server was absolutely excellent!
Literally EVERY single time I come here I get sick.. I've had many different things on the menu and I still get sick. I don't know what they put in there food.. YUCK!

Great service, food was awesome!  Couldn't ask for a better waiter, the portions are perfect and the menu has plenty of options. My favorite is the BBQ chicken pizza. Only wish bud light was on draft!

Mediocre food and terrible service. I found if hard to believe that after asking two employees for condiments 3 times they still forgot to bring it. Then the waiter triple charged us on our bill and the manager gave us an insincere apology. The only good thing was the hostess seated us right away and was extremely attentive and friendly.

CPK has never been our first choice in restaurants. In the past, it was always far to busy with overwhelmed, low quality waiters. We decided to get dinner a few nights ago (thursday i believe.) As to be expected, there was a wait. The staff was friendly and even the manager was helping assist people to their tables. We got sat in no time. Or server (Casandra) was extremely attentive and upbeat, despite the crowed restaurant. She made us feel very welcome, which differed from past experiences. Our drinks (white sangria I high recommend) took a bit longer than desired. But it was so tasty that it made up for the wait. This is was only negative thing we had to say. Food wise, anything with BBQ sauce is amazing! A friendly younger manager even stopped by to make sure we were happy. We will definitely put CPK higher on our list of restaurants!

You can't really go wrong with food at CPK. Everyone knows what they have, as CPK is a national chain with virtually the same food at almost every location.  This review is based on service and environment alone at the CPK in Mission Viejo on Marguerite.  Vince and I frequently use the call in feature and pick up our favorite food. We are here so often, that the pick up people totally recognize us and are super friendly and fantastic. I feel like writing a seperate review just for them, because it would be at least four stars.  However, we rarely eat in-restaurant. That being said, it was a treat to actually go in and decide to sit down for a nice lunch. There wasn't a wait, so that part was easy. But we quickly realized our waiter, while friendly, was really not all that interested in actually providing quality service. He quickly sat us. And left. Came back asked for drink orders quickly - fine. Spent at least 5 minutes flirting with two girls sitting behind us. Don't know if these two were friends of his, or if he was trying to score a date, but I definitely noticed the disparity of attention paid to us since he wouldnt be getting any action from either of us.  Food took a long time, so I asked for bread. He said no problem. Bread never came. More flirting with girls behind us. Food comes, its great of course, but all of a sudden he pays attention to us, asking me questions when my mouth is obviously full of food. Lovely. Food done, waiter no where to be found. Then more flirting with girls behind us. Laughing, flirting, giggling = no diet coke refill for me.  Wait for check, wait for check, wait for check. Check finally comes. No diet coke re-fills. Flirting, laughing, jokes with girls behind us. Wait for him to pick up check, wait for him to pick up check, wait for him to pick up check. More flirting. Cue angry scorpion woman looks from me.  Waiter notices scorpion woman looks, finally completes our check AFTER girls behind us finally leave.  Note to CPK waiter - They weren't actually interested, and you just wasted at least a half an hour of our time. THANKS JERK!

I used to LOVE CPK and really enjoyed their pizzas.  I'm hoping this was just an off day or perhaps I ordered the wrong items. I went here for lunch the other day and had the Hawaiian pizza, tortilla soup, and wedge salad, while the kids had macaroni and cheese.  Bland, bland, bland is all I can say.  The pizza sauce tasted like ketchup and was used ever so sparingly.  Maybe that was a good thing.  The tortilla soup was good.  The wedge salad was ok.  The kids' macaroni and cheese was also very bland.  Hardly any hint of cheesiness to it.  Luckily they're kids and don't care if their food is bland.   Service was good, though. We ended up ordering two ice cream sundaes, so that was the highlight.  Don't know if I'd necessarily spend my money here.  I had a gift certificate, which is how I ended up there for lunch:/
The place is nice but the food was not tasty. I don't think that will come back there,
Bad service, and the food did not taste right. Looks like they only hire ex convicts in this location. I think I will just stick with the one here in town. Ick!
A nice place with a good balance of price, service and food quality.

Pizza was good.  Nothing special.  To me, CPK is a upper-class snooty way of ordering pizza.  Get me a traditional pizzeria any time of the week, and it's always better.  However, we did get great service, and their other foods we had were very good.
The menu has gluten free and vegetarian. I cannot wait to come back and try other items on the menu.

Been there many times and food is good.  Only reason this last visit for a 3 star instead of 5 was the brunette hostess.  She  was rude and acting like we were bothering by showing up for dinner.  She sized my wife up and down in between rolling her eyes at her.

When did the "shark fin" become an appropriate haircut for men?  Seriously?  Do you know how stupid it looks?  It says, "I'm not cool enough to go with the mohawk but I'm a lemming and want to be trendy."   What does this have to do with CPK you ask, well it seems as if 75% of their male waiters are sporting the "fin."   So I'm new to Mission Viejo, still unpacking and not even close to settled so my wife and I have been eating out far too often.  This week we hit up the local CPK.  I like CPK.  It is what it is and the product is usually very good.  We had about a 10 minute wait for a table on a weeknight (with plenty of empty tables, just not enough staff I guess) but it was fine.  I can't really say I've had a bad pizza here.  I love the traditional BBQ Chicken, the garlic chicken and a few others.   The new draw for me though is their line of Neapolitan pizzas.  This is basically the same crust but stretched even thinner so its a thin crust pizza.  Not cracker thin, but thin enough to still be chewy.  I've tried the Sicilian which is really good and this last visit I had Milan which was topped with caramelized onions (AWESOME), sausage and a variety of cheeses.  Great CPK pizza!  Living so close, I'm sure we'll be back.
Your food is fantastic but your centralized ordering for pick up is a joke!  Always wrong.  Please consider bringing it back in house.
Had a great time, excellent service, got right in and the atmosphere was nice. Maybe could've used a little more liveliness from the staff but overall great time.
Not their best location.  Conveniently located on Marguerite Pkwy by the Civic Center.
Went here on a Sunday night. Food was pretty good, service was excellent, our server was very attentive and prompt. No complaints.

Newsflash....... well, maybe a "Semi-Old-flash" from mid 2011, but it explains "a lot!" LOS ANGELES -- Private equity firm Golden Gate Capital is buying California Pizza Kitchen Inc. for about $470 million, three months after the restaurant chain put itself up for sale. (skip to this...) Golden Gate's other restaurant buyouts include the purchase of On the Border last year. And last month Lawson Software Inc. agreed to a $2 billion acquisition offer from Golden Gate and Infor. That explains a lot for me. One of my thoughts, and my opinion about CPK, and On the Border, was that they were "hitting the downward part of their cycle" as a restaurant chain. We just revisited CKP, MV yesterday, early evening. While the physical layout hasn't changed, they have made "food changes." First thing we noticed was a new, tall, thin menu. It's been edited down, but looks like a winner. Their classic fare is still there, (ie; BBQ Chicken Salad). But they do have some new items. (see their website for a menu-listing with nice photos). For a light 6pm dinner we two ordered their "Two Classic Soups in One Bowl"..... Tortilla and Lentil-Pea. The bowl was large, and the soups were very good. They start you off with a complimentary "cut sections of warm french baugette", and a well seasoned olive oil. In the past, bread was served cold. Now, the oil is a great option over butter. My wife had the new Chimmichurri Chicken, grilled chicken breast with a chimmichurri-style sauce, and grilled veggies. My wife felt the vegetables lacked seasoning. I agreed. The chicken was OK, but the overall serving was small, yet the price was $16... which we didn't realize until I paid the bill. That was the only issue we had last night. I ordered my BBQ Chicken Salad, and it was as good as it has always been. ($14). Between the soup, the chicken entree and my salad, we left satisfied. I shared my salad, and my wife gave me some of her chicken and the chimmichurri sauce.  If my wife's entree had not been so overpriced, I might have gone with 4-stars. As our server was attentive. But we'll certainly do future visits, and I'll try a couple of their other new or improved menu items. I know it's a chain...... but this is more an FYI than a "you gotta' go" recommendation. I'd say ck' 'em out. I think they're better... maybe not "better than ever"...... but possibly more pleasing to the palate. (?) BTW....... sent a feedback message via the CPK website with our opinion of their "chimmichurri chicken entree." Curious to see if they respond. (?) VERY NICE RESPONSE FROM CPK just one day after using their "online feedback." The GM of the CPK MV location actually called me early today while driving to visit family in W.L.A. She noted my comments, and said that the feedback was helpful, as she's going to speak with the supervising chef for their restaurant. This is one of the few times that a retailer's "online feedback feature" actually resulted in a callback. Again, I was very, very impressed. I believe she's also sending some gift cert's our way, which wasn't asked for or expected. That alone deserves one more star........ yes it does.

Had dinner here over the weekend... the service was great and the food was excellent as well.  I had the Asparagus and Spinach Spaghettini, but substituted the Multigrain Penne and added chicken.  It had a lot of garlic in it, which I love!

We dilly-dallied for a few days deciding where we would eat on Sunday for a late lunch/dinner. I remembered spotting a CPK down the street and that sealed the deal. I like the location over others I've visited.  The big windows let in a lot of light and we got a prime spot overlooking the street since there really isn't much of a view of anything else around here.  Our host seemed bothered by our presence.  When we first showed up, he was busy organizing the menus and barely heard us when we said "party of 2."  Would it kill you to greet us and smile?  I guess so. As soon as we were seated, our waitress appeared out of thin air.  I already knew what I wanted to drink.  The same as usual - the peach iced tea.  They infuse it with an artificially flavored peach shot and throw in a peach except peaches are out of season and it wasn't as good as I remembered it to be.   We scanned the menu for our pizza choices.  They've added a few since I last visited over a year ago but I settled for the tried and true - the Greek with avocados and he got the Jamaican Jerk.  I was cold so I also ordered a cup of Sedona Tortilla Soup.  This soup is pretty good but doesn't quite compare to the tortilla soup at Islands; I have yet to find something that beats that. We can't really complain about the pizzas.  They're baked in the oven with real logs and arrive piping hot.  We watched a few being made as we waited. The Greek comes with Mediterranean spiced grilled chicken and Mozzarella cheese topped with a chilled Greek salad of cucumbers, red onions, fresh tomatoes, Greek olives, Feta cheese and a lemon-herb vinaigrette and served with homemade Tzatziki sauce and chopped Italian parsley.  And the Jamaican Jerk comes with grilled Jamaican Jerk spiced chicken breast with spicy sweet Caribbean sauce, Mozzarella cheese, applewood smoked bacon, mild onions, roasted red and yellow peppers and green onions.   Yum!   The pizzas were flavorful and delicious.  We got them on the honey wheat bread which is pretty filling so we got half way through and boxed up the rest for later because we wanted to save room for dessert.  During this season, CPK serves up pumpkin cheesecake and it's only available until Christmas.  It's not to be missed.  We shared a slice and that's one thing that hasn't changed over the years and as always I was tempted to buy a whole pie but restrained myself.  On the way out, our host was polite and opened the door for us.  We're not sure what lifted his spirits but we were nonetheless content with full bellies and plenty of leftovers.
The service was nice and so as the food, but a little overpriced and the rest room condition wasn't at good shape. Didn't like the lack of vegan options as well.

My gf is obsessed with CPK - can't get enough of it. So I agreed to take her out to eat this past weekend here because she's been fiending for it. First stop: CPK @ the Irvine Spectrum. On a Saturday night. Big mistake. The place was a zoo - quite literally. The wait time was over an hour. Pass. So, we jetted down the freeway to this location, which is typically slow. And it was. We got seated within 2 minutes of arrival. The staff at CPK are always friendly, and they give you plenty of room to eat and relax. I loathe waiters who think they need to ask how everything is every 5 minutes. When something's bad, trust me, you'll know.  We got a couple of pies on honey wheat dough, pepperoni for her, Jamaican jerk chicken for me. Now, we both noticed that it seems they're slowly but surely shrinking the pizza here. They used to be at least an 1" or 2" larger. Damn economy. Mine was slightly overcooked, but nothing worth making a fuss about. It was an adequate meal overall. I recommend this location over any other simply because it's always going to be far less crowded.

My Daughter and I have a tradition of having lunch together on Saturday afternoon.  We have been to CPK several times and have been quite satisfied.  However, on Saturday, May 7, we were very disappointed.  I ordered the grilled vegetable salad and it was awful.  I told the waiter I was disappointed and he just shrugged.  My daughter also ordered a salad with chicken but didn't like all the greens.  80% of the dishes were composed of greens.  Not at all enjoyable.  We've taken CPK off our Saturday list.

Been to many CPK's in the area, but this one is definitely one of my favorites. Can get busy, but the service was great. Our server Caitlyn was awesome and so sweet. Everything came fast and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend the king pao spaghetti. Great place for families!

This place is horrible.  The waiters are very rude and disrespectful.  I will never eat at this place again.  They will spit on your food and smile in your face.  The staff here is the worst I have ever seen.
Yum lettuce wraps Anna pizza! I love cpk:) or server was very nice and everything came fast even though it was pretty busy
I like there happy hour specials, except they need to include Coors Light because the other beers on HH are not light beer.
Wow! Great service . The guy was so nice and take care every thing we needed ! Go there! :)
Great service, good food and very nice people. My boyfriend and I totally enjoy to come here on Friday.
I am not a chain person. So I was hesitant to venture into a CPK while in California.  I took some take out food and was surprised. Quick and efficient service.

CPK closes at 10 PM on a Thursday, so I called them at 9:24 pm to ask if I placed an order online if it would be ready before they closed at 10 pm. The girl told me yes, so I said ok, I'll go online and place the order. That way I can take a look at the menu and see what the options are. Tried to place the order online but it wouldn't let me set the time for pick up for same day.  So, I called back at 9:34 to ask if I could place a phone order and the girl tells me no, I can't place an order because the Pick Up order cut off is 9:30. I tell her it's 9:34 and the person I spoke to earlier should have said something to me if there was a cutoff. I ask her, "So you're telling me that if I walk in and place an order, you won't wrap it up for me to take home?" And she tells me no.  My husband went in, because he was already there since I said I was placing an order and at 9:35 they told him they shut the kitchen early due to lack of traffic. Gee, no wonder. Sounds like great customer service to me!  Way to go, CPK!  Not only did the quality of your food go downhill in the last couple of years, but your customer service sucks too.

I went with my family on Sunday around 1:00 pm for lunch.  There was no problem finding parking - which can be an issue near the restaurant.  Hostess was very nice and made sure we were seated quickly, in about 5 minutes. The table was clean, as well as the seats. Our server (Quinn) was fantastic and very attentive.  They have a promotion for their rewards plan, so we signed up for free and received a small plate as a reward.  We ordered the Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla and it tasted great.  They did bring bread that was different than they used to do.  I prefer the old way they did things with the bread and butter that was provided before.  The new approach is good, bread and olive oil, but we have a preference for the old way. We ordered pasta, a Chinese chicken salad and two pasta dishes for the kids.  We were very satisfied with the food which was hot and fresh out of the kitchen. What I really want to convey is the outstanding service provided by Quinn (female).  The order was correct, the food arrived quickly, the small plate arrived right away and in plenty of time to enjoy it before the meal arrived.  We did not want for anything.  She was quick on the re-fills for the drinks and made sure any plates were cleared quickly.  We were very, very satisfied with the service and based on that alone, will go back to this location again.

Prices keep going up and up over the last few years, now it's ridiculous. The food has always been great but unfortunately their corporate GREED will be keeping my family of 6 from really ever going back. Servers are nice and quality of food is good so I gave it 2 stars. But $61 (before tip) for 2 kids meals, a salad and pizza is insane. Sorry, but it's just not worth going anymore.
It's a generic chain restaurant. Pros: convenient location, reasonable prices, easy parking, prompt service. Cons: unremarkable food.

CPK = chain goodness.  I love the food here.  It tastes the same no matter where you are.  The service is OK.  The wait is longer than most.   I recommend the Milan pizza neopolitan style and ask for roasted garlic if you love the stinking rose like I do (I haven't been to that restaurant yet, but I'm referring to what Greeks and Romans called garlic).

We went there as a family and everyone ordered something different. I tasted all. They were all perfect. The service was quick. Plus the lady serving us had great communication skills. We enjoyed going there :)

I like CPK.  My bf and I would go here once a month or when we can't think of a new place to dine at.  We would dine here during dinner time.  Each time the wait staff and hostess has been on top of things.  We didn't have to wait long for our seats or for our meals.  I've only tried a few of their dishes and the one I always order is always good.  I always order the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped salad.  Can't go wrong with salad.  The portions are huge for me, even the lunch portion.  I always end up full when dining here.  My Bf usually orders the BBQ pizza and that has always been yummy for him, that's why he always orders it.  Oh, and they have peach iced tea here, which I really like.  Can't find that anywhere else.

I usually go to this CPK during non-peak eating hours, so I can't really speak to whether or not it gets crazy busy, but my guess is that it does.  This CPK seems like every other CPK.  The staff is nice, the food is good, the drinks are good (I especially love their Sangira - I do wish they had a better beer selection).  I love this place because everything I've ever ordered from here I always alter or substitute in some way, and they're always accommodating and never annoyed that I like to make changes.  In fact, if you have a cool waiter, and you try something you don't like, they will totally offer to bring you something different.   As far as CPKs go, you can't go wrong with this one :)

Waited 10 minutes for service or water. Made eye contact with 3 employees. When they started taking the order for someone seated next to me for less than a minute I told the host I was leaving. He asked where I had been siting, I replied the table right in front of you where you seated me.

Continuing to Yelp today, and it's fun.  Wrote reviews on three places where you can get a really good pizza, combined with a few other things. I'm going to rate Claim Jumper above average, because I really think that for a chain restaurant, you can't get a bad meal here.  I am fairly ritualistic about what I order at restaurants, but something about this place begs me to mix it up every time.   My husband and our kids frequent Claim Jumper and if I have discovered a REALLY good appetizer - it's called flatbread, and it is GREAT!  It tastes like it was created in an authentic pizzeria like Pizza e Vino or Pizzeria Rustica.  Yes, it seriously is that good! It's Claim Jumper, so I don't really pay attention to the names of the various servers and managers, and I really don't go there for the ambiance or the wine or the service.  Its just an "above average" place to take the family and I'm so happy they have that one item that is to die for!  I'm sure you'll find one you love too :)

I have been coming to this location now for 15+ years and in the past few months it has gone down hill fast.  I have never had issues with my order before and now it seems like they can't get a single order correct.  Tonight we were seated at a dirty table with no silverware and were told someone would be by to clean it.  Our drinks came, but nobody cleaned the table, bread came and nobody cleaned the table, our salads came and still no silverware or cleaning of our table.  Three people told us it would be cleaned, but we sat for 15 minutes before I got up and had to go ask for someone to clean our table.  Then our food came out and my salad was wrong.  They took it back and brought me a new one that was right, but 10 minutes later they brought me another one.  They said it was made for me, but if it was, they got that one wrong as well as it included everything I had askes for them to leave off.  I guess 1 out of 3 isn't bad if you played baseball, but to get it wrong that many times is pretty bad.  Please bring back the old standards and competent  people that used to be here.

Well, that was disappointing! We used to really enjoy going to CPK in Northern California before we moved to Orange County. Not so much anymore. Dishes and utensils were dirty, portions are smaller and more expensive (I had the full size CPK Club salad, which is now about the same as half size used to be), tiny little sour dough bread appears very much to be store bought. About half way through the meal a lady walked into the restaurant, going table to table trying to sell a knock off memory foam pillow. No sign of the manager or hostess. Service was okay, but not nearly good enough to make up for all the negatives. We won't be going back!

7:30 at night and it was busy weeknight!  My favorite is the pasta dish but since I am watching carbs I got a cobb salad it was very good.  My husband got some kind of pizza but it was below his standards.
Came here in a pinch. Mistake. Bobble-headed waitstaff more eager to ask you if you're doing ok without actually waiting to hear your response.

I have been a big fan of CPK's for many years, eating at least 10 different ones over the years. The Mission Viejo location is the most convenient for me, but after the other night I will never go back. After we were seated, no wait, it took what seem like forever to be served. The waiter had no personality, like I was imposing on his time.   I ordered my usual Stella Artois and watched it sitting on the bar for about five minutes while he chatted with a fellow employee.  My wife was about to go get our drinks herself when he  finally got around to it.  My beer was something other than a Stella and I decided not to drink it.  When he came back I told him it wasn't a Stella and no apology, instead he argued with me that it was indeed what I ordered.  I ordered a different beer and wondered if after 10,000 Stellas if I am qualified to know how certain beers should taste. My favorite Jerk Chicken Pizza was over cooked and my wife's soup was luke warm. Nothing like throwing away $50 and walking out mad. Never again will I go back to this location, maybe Laguna Hills next time.
They need to step it up a bit.  It seems so much better 10 years ago. Food seems very bland I won't be coming back!

Your typical CPK. We eat here often as it is close to the house and they do curbside as well so easy for pickup. Pizzas are great. The Sicilian is my favorite. The salads are good. I like the original chopped and the BBQ chicken salad. Pasta is good. Peach iced tea is good. I don't think I have ever had anything that was not good here. Kids like it. Wife likes it. Can be a little pricey but worth it.

I only got the hummus and pita bread, but my friend and his family all ordered pizzas and salads. They all raved about it. The hummus and pita was good, but I feel like the hummus could have had more spices in it, and it was a little too grainy in texture for my taste

Eh, it was OK.  I liked the variety of pizzas on the menu, but not much in the way of appetizers or anything else.   Small dessert menu. I got the wild mushroom pizza.  It was dripping with grease and I had to use my napkin to pat some of it off.  The mushrooms were flavorful and cooked well.  I love mushrooms and the variety on the pizza was great! Service was pretty good, too.  CUTEST waiter!  Ok, he wasn't cute.  He was really pretty, just like everyone else in OC! I had the banana chocolate cake for dessert.  Nothing spectacular.  It came with a side of vanilla ice cream (as did my sister's chocolate cake dish) but it wasn't *good* ice cream.   It was a good meal for after a long day at the beach, but even back in the PHX, I probably won't eat at CPK again. There's WAY better to be had.

About 3 weeks ago, my husband and I took put kids there for Friday dinner. It was busy at that time and the girl told us the waiting time around 20-25 mins. We were happily to wait and my husband wrote his name down. A few minutes later, another family come in and the man has the same name as my husband so when they call my husband name and also the waitress came to that family, I heard the lady told the waitress that we were first but the check in girl still told them it is ok.. Hello CPK manager, we don't need free meal, we were just need a better service since we are regular customers. We come there almost every week because it is my son's favorite restaurant and we live around the corner. I would though the girl will apologize to us instead of giving us mean look when we left.. We will take break from this CPK for awhile.. Hope the manager pay attention of the services,

We used to eat at this CPK a lot when the kids were little, but had not been there for two years. We ate there last night, and will NOT return! Not sure if there is a new owner or manager, but the place is filthy. I had to wipe the crumbs off the seat before sitting down, and the menus were sticky with a rare assortment of food all over them. Yuck! The caesar salad had wilted lettuce and almost no dressing and the white pizza was just ok. The saving factor was the glass of red wine which they only had to pour and not prepare. Should have gone to BJs Chicago Pizza instead.

Since I had been carrying around a gift card for CPK for ages, we finally got around to trying it out when we are in the area. We both had entree salads  and we're not impressed. My wife's Thai salad had a very small portion of chicken and my Morrocan spiced Chicken had too many dates and not near enough dressing. On the plus side, the service was very friendly.

I think CPK has it down to the point where you can expect a fairly consistent, good menu wherever you go, whatever state you're in, and whatever city you find yourself in. This one in Mission Viejo has the same good food, but like another reviewer said earlier, the staff seems to be pretty inattentive. It might have something to do with all the spiky-haired staff talking to the just-out-of-high school-looking coworkers, but that just might be me. CPK is a fairly safe pick at any time of day for most cravings; you won't go wrong with their menu.

This CPK is a good place to dine in for kids and adults alike. They offer all sorts of pizzas with some really good choices like the Spicy Chipotle, California Club and Sicilian. They have one of the healthier version of the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad around (not heavy on the sodium content) as well as the Thai Chicken Salad. Service here is not bad either. The restaurant does get quite busy during the weekends as expected so come around 5ish to secure a table before the dinner rush. They also offer kids birthday parties here (we attended one) which is a neat idea.

This place Was one of my favourites. Today, the service was soooo bad. I had to wait for 8 minutes to be seated and when the lady came and i said you need more people hired, she said oh i was in rhe back checking the rest rooms. There is no one to check on the restrooms but te one who is supposed to seat guests???? The server was okay yet he would just put the plates and walk away without looking at me. I tried to Say thank you and he never bother to say youre welcome. The fork was dirty so when i asked for another one he said yeah sure but didnt bother apologizing. Very unprofessional. The food was alright yet no attention was made. I ordered a chicken tequila fett. And i get a piece of shrimp in my plate along with different types of pasta. This speaks much of how much care is put in your plate lol This place is horrible, dont waste your money , at least not at  this location. Another customer lost, great job !

It is kinda a tradition to come here for birthdays... The food is amazing and the appetizers are great as well. But sometimes the service takes a little bit to long Anyway I would suggest this restaurant to any one.
We don't come often but I really think they have stepped up their game. The food and service were great and the sangria was fantastic. Also OMFG BUTTER CAKE
Absolutely horrible service! Manager came out of the office one time to touch a plate.  Server checked up only after we asked someone else to help us. I won't be back to this location!

Went there for lunch on March 30, 2016  My main complaint about this restaurant is that the last two times I have been there, the front entrance and the ladies restroom area both inside and outside smelled of sewer.  My first visit was in January. Smell was worse than ever, I didn't speak up then because I was treating a friend to lunch, but it was atrocious. I called the manager when I got home, and she didn't take me seriously, said she didn't notice anything, and told me the smells must have come from across the street, and it was a city problem. I do not plan to return to this location. It is very unappetizing.

We went on a Veterans Day and appricate the fact that they honor the vets with a free meal from a special menu.  The service was fine, the hostess was especially kind in thanking the 2 vets in our party for their service.  My son and I were really disappointed in our pasta dishes.  They have doubled the size of the plate they serve it on, and cut the actual pasta serving in half.  We each had less than a cup of food.  My zucchini shrimp scampi was almost 16 dollars.  It appears that CPK has delusions of grandeur and has forgotten it's a pizza place.  All in all not a good value and be prepared to eat a lot of bread.

I agree with other reviews that CPK is a solid three stars. The food wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't good enough to go back. We ordered for curbside and the person who took the order over the phone was very friendly and helpful.  The bbq chicken salad we ordered was huge, but they only gave us a half-full cup of ranch dressing it was nowhere near enough! The bbq chicken pizza we asked to be made into a thin crust (which cost extra to do) just looked like they made it bigger but used the same amount of ingredients. We also ordered a roasted garlic pizza which apparently has no sauce or flavor. Overall pretty disappointing, especially because of how much they charge for this subpar food.

I can't really speak of the food at this location because we never got seated; however, I was disappointed in their service.  I love CPK and the family decided to come here tonight for dinner. We waited through an empty waiting area to a full waiting area and then again to an empty one. I literally was watching people walk out the door (finished with their meals) that came in after us. We had 3 adults and 2 kids in our group and they couldn't find a place for us to sit (although they sat a larger group that came in after us after a while). They tried putting us in a booth that literally my infant carrier wouldn't even fit in. When we told the host that it didn't fit and that it was too small, he just stared at us. I eventually said, can you please tell us what you'd like us to do because we can't leave the baby in the middle of the table. We ended up leaving.  Honestly, we will stick with the Laguna Hills or Tustin Market Place one. Much better service there.  I will say that Reid was pretty nice and tried to help us (hence the extra star), but the manager and the other host were not so helpful. Oh well!

Love the food but my God, when did CPK get so expensive? $75 for dinner for a family of 3 is just crazy! You guys are pricing yourself out of being a family restaurant, which is obviously your targeted clientele. :-(

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: CPK totally revamped their interior. Whole new design for everything from the tables to the menus to the decor. With a remodel brings a change in price. They appear fancier when you walk in so naturally the prices have gone up. Pizzas are now by far the most inexpensive entre you can buy.. They have many entres that are well over $20 each, and many "fancy" cocktails that are over $10.  That's all good if you're willing to throw down a huge amount of money to go to a CPK.. But it's still CPK. I miss the old menu, the old decor, and the old prices. Don't think I'll be back soon.
One of our favorite spots and the kids love it! We always get the kung pao spaghetti and butter cake! Yum!

Had a wonderful lunch experience. Waitress Anna Young was so kind and attentive, even while the restaurant was busy. It had been a while since I've had service that exceptional! The salad was delicious and I think it goes without saying that the pizza was bomb too.

New manager (blonde hair). Came here on Sunday and was totally dead. Lots of empty tables and we asked to sit in a booth since there were  open but they insisted that we sit at a table with our two children. Guess new management isn't as on top of it as the old manager - she was awesome. Guess it's to zpizza and blaze for us - thank goodness lots of other options:-)
Stephen...general manager, was gracious with his time to show my girls about pizza dough flipping.  We have always had a great experience, the staff, the food, the restaurant just an A+.

I've been coming here for years and I've always had a very pleasant time. It doesn't matter if I come in a party of 2 or 20 the wait staff has been attentive, friendly, and quick. The food is always hot, fresh, and tasty.  Only complaint for my last trip? They didn't bring the bread out for our table. Oh well. Nothing I'll cry over. It's not like I really needed to eat more bread with my meal.

Came here a couple nights ago with my boyfriend. And let me tell you, whoever is doing their hiring here is doing it right. Everyone we came in contact with was so sweet and genuine. You can tell it came from their hearts. Our server was awesome, wish I could remember her name, beautiful blonde girl.  Food was awesome! Signed up and downloaded the app to become a rewards member (took maybe a minute) and got a free appetizer!  Over all amazing experience and could not of been any more pleased with the service and food!

Curbside pickup for nights we don't want to prep food or just want pizza and a beastly salad? Added to our arsenal. Great gluten-free options for those who are intolerant (if you're not- just eat food without your trendy parameters).
Has a nice sized patio, but only allows service dogs. Had to walk down to Chipotle instead.

Been years since I stopped in this location. Decor is beautiful  and rustic. Really like the friendliness and professionalism of their takeout service. Ordered a kid's cheese pizza, Tequila Fettuccini Pasta w/o chicken and their Kung Pao w/o chicken. Strange to see mine priced without the w/chicken yet the tequila pasta was given the chicken price even without chicken. Also,we had about a 35 min drive home and maybe the wait dried out the pasta, who knows, but it was UNUSUALLY dry from our normal orders at other locations. Even the pizza had little to no red sauce. Really disappointed. Dinner was the most bland I've experienced so I wonder if their ingredients or quality of ingredients have changed along with their decor?? If I revisit I'll have to note the sauce issue and also request them to not water the sauce down if I do request more sauce, as that has happened as well, now that I think recall.
Food was good. Service was horrible. They did not bring one of our plates, messed up another order, and took forever to refill drinks.
Wild mushroom pizza was great!  Good neighborhood location, easy parking right there. The tortilla soup was lukewarm, but tasty. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

Actually a good pizza and salad. The curbside service is very helpful and added a star for me. Our usual order is chicken waldorf salad plus 2 thin crust pizzas to share. Favorites are Thai chicken, the Sicilian, and the pesto chicken. Always on thin crust!

i think i got 2 days worth of calories in a satisfying meal but nothing special. we split all of this food so i got to try alot of different things. first off i had the spring rolls. the cabo chicken ones were great! the thai ones with peanut sauce were a close second but the ones with marinara...eh not so much. i had a few pieces of the bbq chicken pizza which was pretty good and this is what its famous for but once again for all the calories consumed??? i had a bit of the jumbalaya which is basically pasta with shrimp and andoulle sausage. been to louisiana a few times...this is not jumbalaya. had a bite of mac n cheese...im an adult now, i love mac n cheese but i don't want to eat that in public! ;) for desert we had key lime pie which was AMAZING! hot fudge sundae...fudge was hard at the bottom. red velvet cake looked good but i didn't taste. way too full! so to sum it all up, everything was decent but nothing stood out to me like i had to absolutely have it! but for a food chain it is better than most
Rude staff and below par food. Really unimpressed and wont go back.
Really like the CPK in MV.  Great casual dining and excellent service.  The staff is just the best!
Great service. See Trish at the counter. Best most consistent food and service. Great team watching out for you. Fun and tasty.

Update: I submitted my complaint on the CPK website, and promptly got a call from the restaurant's GM.  I am satsified that he has addressed the situation, and look forward to giving this location another try in the near future.
Great food, mediocre inattentive service.  Not bad, just not memorable.
my favorite salad is sold here, the bbq chopped chicken is amazing!

this place was ok. pricey! service was a little slow. we waited 15 min for our table. this was after the lunch rush. my cousin and i split a half cobb salad and split the bbq chicken hawaiian pizza. both were delicious! and just enough food! the bill came: for the pizza, half cobb and two iced teas, $37! geez louise. the food was good, but come on. for lunch?

So my husband and I went to lunch today at CPK, we each had a salad (one half size one full size) and 2 iced teas....our bill was $32.58 + tip...grand total for 2 salads and 2 soft drinks: $37.58!!!!!  Are you kidding me?  there was no fish in these salads either.  I don't know about anyone else, but that is way too pricey for lunch.  Not only that, my husband didn't even like the Thai salad he ordered...to plain.  Meh, probably wont go back...way too many good restaurants out there to spend money at.
mmmmm amazing sangria and spinach artichoke dip-- definitely a fan!

This place is really almost in my backyard, yet I don't think I have been here for over a year. They have remodeled and  I like the changes. It feels warmer and more inviting. It took a little over 5 minutes to be seated , it was not  crowded but they were getting a booth ready for two of us which I appreciated.  Two severs came to our table and welcomed us bask as if they knew us. We told them we had not been here since the remodel. Just one minute later our waiter brought us complimentary chips and avocado to welcome us back, nice touch. My friend and I both ordered the half portion Cobb salad. Our order came pretty quickly and the salads were plenty big for being a half portion.  Over all I like this place, it's just more money than I care to spend on my lunch hour. I guess that's on me.

I've been here multiple times, and I really like the updated menu. I can't eat pizza, so I usually go for the salads. I have tried:  Quinoa Arugula Salad-this is my favorite item on the entire menu. I love arugula and quinoa, and the dressing is delicious. It tastes even better if you add chicken (but that's like $4 extra). Roasted Vegetable Salad- I honestly don't think you need to add any protein to it; it is delicious as it is. Although, they drenched mine in too much dressing. I like the roasted eggplant.  Banh Mi Bowl-this sounded really good and healthy so I had to try it out. It was hard to eat because the carrots were spiralized really big. I also didn't like the bean sprouts. From the menu, I couldn't tell if it was a salad or a bowl kind of deal. It's basically a salad, and there wasn't that much food on the plate.  The prices here are too expensive for the type of restaurant it is. Most salads are $11-$13 but to add protein it's an extra $4-$6! The food is pretty good, but I'll stick to my usual. For appetizers, definitely order the dumplings. They also give you free bread. The last time I was here, the service was great. Our waitress was friendly and the food came out very quick. The time before that, our server brought the appetizers with the actual meal, and took forever to come back and take our order. So it's inconsistent.

After knowing that they offer a "tricolor" pizza, I rated this place a 4. I have a favorite pizza place in Santa Monica that makes the best salad thin crust pizza. I miss it. So, when I heard that CPK offered something similar, (NOT IN MENU) I asked for it. I'm happy. The fish tacos were great too!

Pizza, avocado egg rolls, and pesto penne with shrimp were delicious. I truly enjoyed the bread that is brought to the table accompanied by the olive oil and herb dip. I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and the thoughtful service at this location. I'll try to make my way back here sometime soon.

Came in at 845pm on a Thursday and this place was popping. I was a bit surprised but it's one of the few restaurants in the area open until 10pm. We sat in the bar since it was happy hour. $4 for Corona sounded good. Service was fast and our server was very nice. I ordered the chicken piccatta which was AMAZING. The pasta was my favorite, it was in a delicious lemony sauce with capers YUM. I will definitely get it again. And we also ordered the Kung Pao spaghetti which was a tasty dish. It was like a chow mein that had been mixed with kung pao chicken and drizzled with peanuts.

Why change a good thing? One of the good things was the pizza dough that the CPK chain used to use. It's been several years since it changed -- used to be a little sweeter and a little fluffier --  but I still miss it. It was just so good.  I digress - so - this specific location.  It's kind of weird - there are a lot of doors along the side, but there's only one hostess stand. If you enter through the door that is positioned closest to the parking lot, you have to walk through part of the dining room to get to the host stand. In my opinion, it's designed weird. I guess that door is there since it makes it easier for the staff to deliver takeout food to cars? But it's still weird for anyone who is dining in that vicinity.  There can sometimes be a small wait at this location, but I've never experienced anything too severe. There of been times when it's been a bit like a ghost town, but maybe I just eat at peculiar times? Who knows.  I do credit the business a lot - there really added some good things to the menu over the past year or so. I really like the Baja chicken spring rolls. Note that they are not your typical spring roll, but they are delicious nonetheless. There is also a delicious selection of salads. And of course - the pizzas. Some are pricey, but I know the location doesn't get to control that.  Nice neighborhood staple in Mission Viejo. 2017: 47/100

For the first time in a loooong  time we got great service, even though it was a busy Saturday night. The server was one of the best we ever had. He smiled the entire time. He was so friendly and brought out food out quick. I must say the food was on the lukewarm side. But the great service made up for it. I wish I would have learned the server's name so I can give him a shout out. I left my receipt at the restaurant so I'm out of luck. Thanks to the management for REALLY improving the service at this location. The food is always good so nothing to complain, but the last few times we were there service was lacking. But I'm so happy because we had a really good meal and great service. Nice turn around!

Takeout on 12/29. Was told food would be ready at 6:38. Waited over 30m and salads sat out on counter entire time. In addition to 30m wait in line, they forgot to make one of the items and waited another 15m. Complete out of control and no management. CPK management needs to look at this store or the online app that you determines pickup time.

This place is a joke. Horrible service. Never got a menu. Asked for water for the 6 of us we got 2. Mac n cheese had no sauce. The Original BBQ Choppwd Chic salad is $12.00 for a sald the size of a side dinner salad.  Management is clueless as what to do in staffing a large party of 23. 1 waiter taking orders, filling water and drinks....food came out cold. Now I remember why I stopped coming here. Unforunately, I had to come here for a.6th grade fundraiser.

Oh man once me and my friend are here like every month, now the service, potion size is bad. The last time I took my wife around 8:45 pm and the place already looked like they were ready to close but 30 minutes to go. Chairs up and no one even came to talk to us at all until I walked up to them and asked for a menu. Should of left but my wife wanted to try.  The food taste ok but small potions and steep prices, well I haven't gone back and probably never will.

I probably have dined at every CPK from LA to OC over the years but this particular restaurant is located on Marguerite in Mission Viejo. I've noticed that they have a more rustic look as far as the interior decor giving their restaurant a warm and cozy vibe. Most of the nearby restaurants closes around 8 or 9pm on the weekdays so its always convenient that CPK closes @10 pm and when hunger strikes its always great to satisfy your hunger at this place. Service is always good and the food is always on point. There was even a time in the past when I ordered take out and there was a mistake in the orders and missed food items and when I called and spoke to the manager and explained the situation , he was quick to correct it and as a result my next take orders were compensated.  I've tried everything on the menu but my all time favorite food items that I always go back to are the Sicilian Pizza, Arugula salad, Waldorf salad, and Kung pao spaghetti with chicken. You cannot go wrong with anything here because everything is tasty and satisfying. Of course I can't forget about the Butter Cake which is the ultimate sweet goodness. This will alwaye be a place of choice whenever it's nearby and I cannot decide on what places to eat.
Thank you for still being open and serving after my 12+ hour day! Tequila Chicken Fettuccine for Baby, Cedar Plank Salmon for me! YUMMY...

Agree with many other posters, CPK is way overpriced for hit or miss chain food. One of my biggest pet peeves is a restaurant that nickels and dimes for everything and CPK is one of them. Want your pizza with thin crust? That's  an additional 1.50, add avocado to your salad? 2.50 Glass of wine? Would you like the 6oz for the price shown on the menu or the 12oz where we just double the price? Don't waste your money on over salted sub par food, go elsewhere

We ordered two pizzas, a pasta and a flatbread. I had to wait for my meal. When I got home with my bag of food, I live around the corner, it was all cold and the flatbread looked like it was cooked last week and microwaved. When I went back to ask if that was acceptable presentation the girl at the pick up area told me "ya, it's a flatbread, that's it'  Totally unsatisfied.
Can't complain of this place. Stefan was the best server tonight!!! Made our family birthday celebration a greater one!!! Thank you

I absolutely love CPK and all the food they serve here.. however tonight had a pretty bad experience with their curbside service.. I only ordered curbside because I recently had surgery and it's hard for me to walk/ get in/out of the car. I called when I arrived waited 5 minutes the guy said someone would be right out.. no one came out so I called again & another 5 minutes went by so I finally got out of my car to go inside and the lady finally was walking out and said sorry we have a no host sometimes they don't tell us.. the lady doing our curbside service was very very sweet, but it's a little unsettling knowing I called twice within 10 minutes and talked to TWO different hosts and neither of them let her know.. not sure if I'll use the curbside again here.

I was pregnant-craving the Thai Crunch Salad. Really hard. Love that salad.  And I have to say The Mission Viejo CPK was bumpin' on a Wednesday! The place was packed but they got us seated in less than 5 minutes and the service was great. And they brought us a free appetizer!

CA Pizza kitchen is your typical California style Italian restaurant. They have pizzas, sandwiches, soup, salad, and bar style appetizers. The restaurant decor is modern and very clean.  The one negative is that it can get very loud, so it's not a good place if you want to have meetings and stuff.  My 3 friends and I came around 11:30 PM. It was before lunch rush, so wasn't too crowded.  Our server was attentive and friendly, and frequently came to check on us.  We all got the lunch special, a half pizza with soup or salad combo ($10.95). I highly recommend getting this for lunch since most of the other stuff on the menu is over $10.  I got a half BBQ chicken pizza with the Farmers Market soup. (Butternut squash soup) Food came in about 15 min.  My pizza had a fluffy crust with BBQ sauce with onions, chicken. I personally like crispy crust pizza, but it was well cooked.  The thing I didn't like was that it didn't have enough chicken. :(  The soup was hot and creamy, also chunky which I like.  The portion size is reasonable, so it's perfect for lunch~  Overall a great place for lunch with friends!

50 employees no one wants to work. Chapter 11 coming soon. Took for ever to get the food. No one cares to follow up. Eventually had to ask if the food was getting picked from nearby cpk. Place is a joke. Employees just chatting with each other. Management standing around on phones, just amazing.

On one of those rare rainy California nights the California Pizza Kitchen stood bright to fill our tummies with that yummy pizza delight! CPK pretty much lives and breathes that Cali style we all know and love from the design of the building to the drinks they serve that are infused with those Cali ingredients that just hit the Cali spot to the pizza's pastas and other dishes that keep you warm on those cold Cali nights! I've always been a fan of the California Pizza Kitchen as their pizzas are quite yummy and just bursting with flavor and fresh ingredients which is something you usually don't get out of a chain! The real kicker for their pizza's has to be the wheat crust it is sooo delicious and just all around amazing when you add it to one of their delicious pizza concoctions as I really don't see very many pizza places that offer a wheat crust at all so it makes it a very tasty unique experience! Pretty much the only downfall I've really ever experienced at a CPK is their service it's generally a bit shaky always and I'm not really sure why so if you plan on visiting just be prepared for this. This time around we had their avocado club egg rolls they were super good and just all around scrumptious even more so when I added some of the sauce they gave us to them I'm not exactly sure how to describe the sauces but needless to say they were quite yummy! We had a pepperoni, sausage, & mushroom pizza on the wheat crust of course and after the first warm bite it was like wow this is quite yummy and just hit the spot for the both of us as we were a little bit wet from heading in from the pouring rain! Seriously though one of the funny parts of the night had to be that they were playing The Simpsons on the TV's throughout the CPK I mean come on who doesn't love them! Overall a visit to CPK is always a good choice and something that was long over do this past time and something that I'll make sure it's not years again before I head back!

The sangria tasted like fruit juice. I ordered a mushroom pasta dish that looked very good in the picture for $15! When it came it belly had any food in the dish and very little wild mushrooms and a little pasta. I don't eat much but I had to borrow food from my haughtiest and husbands dish. Our friends ordered pasta and they weren't very happy with their food either. Service was very lousy too. Too many tables for the servers to cover. We'll probably won't come back again.

Roasted Vegetable Salad with sautéed salmon.  The vegetables came out warm and roasted. :)  The sautéed salmon came out as small bite sized pieces. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was well seasoned, kind of peppery taste, and complemented the roasted vegetables tremendously well!!!!  TONS & TONS of roasted veggies GOODNESS!!!!! It all includes: asparagus, eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers and onions.  with roasted corn, sun-dried tomatoes and topped with AVOCADOS! ***My favorite. Avocados always saves the day and makes everything taste so much better :)

My husband and I dined here 4 nights ago.  Our first option was an Italian restaurant nearby, but the wait was too long and we had a sitter at home to get back to.  So, we just decided to go with a good ole standard and eat at CPK.  When we walked in, there was a 10 minute wait.  I'd normally not wait for substandard food, but it was better than the wait time at our first choice.  So we stayed.  Several minutes after we walked in, a party of 7 walked in, they did NOT have a reservation, and they were seated before us!  Weird, I thought, there are PLENTY of empty tables so why would we still be waiting and this large party be seated?  We were finally seated at a table that had been empty the entire time we'd been waiting.  When we sat down, the table was dirty.  Oops!  So the hostess that didn't have the mostess (she had such a sour puss on her face!) came back and wiped it down with the enthusiasm of one that is relegated to cleaning toilets for a living.  We were finally helped by our server, at least she was smiling, but they seemed to have an issue because we waited FOREVER for our drinks and our appetizer came out 2 minutes before our entrees.  Also, I forgot to mention the plates were dirty, too.  And the bill was FAR too expensive for such a disappointing experience.  The staff was not happy to be there, the dishes and utensils were dirty, the service was slow, and the food was not great.  Reminds me why I rarely eat at CPK and I definitely won't be trying it again any time soon.
Huge fan of CPK but they eliminated virtually all comfortable booths for solid wood HARD chairs and tables.  Think McDonalds when it come to comfort.   WONT BE BACK!
Always consistently good no matter which one I've tried!  Menu continues to evolve and new items are delicious!

Didn't even get a chance to eat here.  If you're gonna advertise that you're open till a certain time you probably shouldn't shut down the kitchen 30 minutes prior to that time.  Definitely disappointed.

This is my kids favorite Resturante. The food tastes great and the service is decent i am in love with their small plate menu and cannot get enough of their soups. My daughter is a big fan of BBQ Chicken pizza and my son obsessed with Mac and Cheese. Highly recommend for casual family lunch or dinner. Evenings and weekends get crazy busy. Call in advance and reserve your table.

In the past I have always just ordered their BBQ Chopped chicken salads, a popular go-to dish, but the last time I carb loaded I tried their garlic basil olive oil pasta and loved it.  I was excited to eat it again. We started our meal with one of their new flatbreads. Have you noticed how flatbreads have been trending lately? We tried their shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread and it was wonderful. So full of flavor packed onto a thin crispy flatbread. Great start. Apparently the garlic pasta is no longer on their menu and the server said its now a "secret menu item". Garlic olive oil pasta is as basic as it gets so not sure how its considered "secret" but when we received it, it was tomato based.  Not how we remembered it. Although I was confused I tried it anyways and it was just  Just didnt hit the spot for me. Maybe it should be kept secret?  The kids loved the Alfredo fusilli. For just a $1 more we got ice cream sundaes to top it off. Overall a decent dinner. I would definitely order their flatbread again and maybe next time stick to my roasted veggie salad or chopped BBQ chicken salad.

WOW..what a horrible experience.  We went at 9pm.  Two hostesses at front desk acted like we were bothering them,  Restaurant was more than 3/4 empty.  Dirty tables everywhere,. servers standing around, and still took us 5 minutes to get seated.  They brought us to a table with napkins and dirty food underneath it.  Also a 10 top table with unbused food was next to it which looked like it had been there for some time.  Asked for a booth..response was " Well you will have to wait 10 minutes for us to clean a table"..We ask for manager, whose response was..."the hostesses just don't know any better."  The customer who comes in an hour before closing should have the same experience as the first customer of the day.  they clearly just wanted to go home.  As regular customers of CPK, we will not being going back to this location.. there priorities and training are way off. Avoid Mission Viejo CPK!!!!

The food is honest, it's fresh, and always tasty! The service is alway great and very fast at this location. So far all of the servers I have had there are great and the Managers are always so friendly and they come by the table every time to make sure that everything is good. It's perfect for family night with the kids...my kids love CPK!

I've always loved going to CPK, their salads are always delicious . I was kind of disappointed this time,  I had angel hair spaghetti and it was just OK.   It was dry and needed more sauce. They were very busy and by the time I could get the waitresses attention most of our group was finishing up their mail. They've always been good in the past so I will definitely give them another chance.

The food was delicious but for me the five stars was due for the server we had. Kurt is awesome. He is fast, polite, and just plain friendly. He was on top of everything but without being overwhelming. That is a fine line and this guy walked it perfectly. Give him a huge high five!!!! Kurt you rock.

We stopped in for a late lunch. It wasn't too busy but the service was slow, not what it usually is at this location. I ordered the Italian chopped salad but either they don't chop it anymore like they used to or the cook used the wrong lettuce. I love a nice chopped salad.  This was the first time in this location with the new decor, I like it. It doesn't say 80s anymore, they did a good job updating the experience and adding new menu items...although I usually get the same thing.

Giving the highest rating possible and it has nothing to do with the food. It is based entitled on the service we received. We went in on a Wednesday night and were seated in Luis' section. From now on I will request to be seated in his section. He was great. We had a party of 5 with 3 kids. Even my kids commented on how awesome he was.

I always seem to enjoy California Pizza Kitchen and they seem to be very consistent between all of their change locations. This location is convenient here in the land of Suburbia of Mission Viejo. The wifi is excellent here and was easy to sign in with my iPad. I always enjoy the BBQ chicken pizza and it was great that they had stone IPA on tap. Everyone was very nice even though we had a very long meeting on a Friday night. I highly recommend California Pizza Kitchen because they have some salads also.

I have never ordered anything that was disappointing!  Recently tried their Margarita Pizza...unbelievable..loved it!  Would highly recommend their Arugula/Quinoa Salad and Mushroom/Spinach Flatbread.  I always try to remember to take a bottle of wine, since the corkage fee is only $5...their wines are pricey and not to my liking.

I've been coming here for years and mostly have a great experience. I used to get the Thai Crunch salad 2-3 times per week but the CPK corporate folks changed the chicken supplier and the chicken is a gross rubber mess now. My friends got other salads and it's the same gross chicken. Get another supplier! Salads are no stars now and I order something else. The manager confirmed they receive complaints on the new chicken and offered to grill me a piece instead of what's supplied. Mac and cheese bites and pizzas are good but I miss my Thai crunch. Please listen to a faithful customer and change your supplier. Thanks!

I used to live quite close to this CPK & visited here many times.  The open design makes for an airy, spacious look, but at the cost of noise -- conversation is sometimes difficult if it's crowded.  Service has always been pleasant, and the food is consistently good -- they've recently changed the menu again, removed a couple things I like, added a couple new things to try -- so it goes as part of a corporate chain.  Love the salads, though, they're quite fresh & interesting.  Still a favorite stop when I go back to visit friends in the old neighborhood.

I always enjoy going to CPK. They have consistently good food that is priced friendly for people. I never leave hungry. I generally order a pizza, after all it's in the name. ;p. I also like how they serve the bread now with the oil instead of butter.   As for desserts, I love the Buttercake. I don't get it often because I'm not a huge dessert eater. That being said, it's still scrumptious.  The restaurant has more parking around the back, which is good because sometimes I find during busy times that the parking lot in front of the restaurant (when turning in from the light) to be full or only have like 1 spot left.

Had the small plate poblano and sausage pizza and a cut of pea and barley soup for lunch. Both were very tasty and the pizza was a suggestion from the server Tony. Just enough and not too full. Wasn't too crowded or loud and service was accommodating and not pushy. Took an iced tea to go and the cup was leaking so quickly replaced no trouble at all.  I would come back
